solution_line_template: Since Daisy is 6 inches taller than Reese, she must be {reese_height} inches + {daisy_taller_than_reese} inches = {daisy_height} inches tall.

Parker is {parker_shorter_than_daisy} inches shorter than Daisy, making her {daisy_height} inches - {parker_shorter_than_daisy} inches = <<{daisy_height}-{parker_shorter_than_daisy}={parker_height}>>{parker_height} inches.

The average height of the three of them is ({reese_height} inches + {daisy_height} inches + {parker_height} inches) / {number_of_people} = <<({reese_height}+{daisy_height}+{parker_height})/{number_of_people}={average_height}>>{average_height} inches.
